Key Match Events: Kusal Mendis made a 37-ball 60 as Sri Lanka defeated Bangladesh by two wickets.
Chamika Karunaratne was run out for 16.
Taskin Ahmed took 2 wickets for 24 runs.
Ebadot Hossain took 3 wickets in two overs.
Sri Lanka chased down the target of 184 in 19.2 overs for a two-wicket win.
Bangladesh bowled 8 wides and 4 no balls, while Sri Lanka bowled no wides or no balls.
Pre-Game Insights: Dasun Shanaka, the Sri Lanka captain, won the coin toss and opted to bowl first.
Sri Lanka made one change to their playing XI with Matheesha Pathirana benched and replaced by Asitha Fernando.
Bangladesh made three changes with Mohammad Naim, Anamul Haque, and Mohammad Saifuddin dropped and replaced by Sabbir Rahman, Mehidy Hasan Miraz, and Ebadot Hossain.
Both Sri Lanka and Bangladesh needed to win the match to qualify for the Super Four stage.
Miscellaneous Highlights: The match was played at the Dubai International Cricket Stadium.
Sri Lanka have won the Asia Cup tournament five times before, while Bangladesh finished runners-up in 2018.
